sentences: Powell Jobs resides in Palo Alto, California, with her three children.

Early life and career

Powell Jobs grew up in West Milford, New Jersey.

Personal life after Steve Jobs's death

She is reportedly in a romantic relationship with former Washington, D.C. mayor Adrian Fenty.

On July 28, 2017, Powell Jobs' organization Emerson Collective (based in Palo Alto, California) acquired majority ownership of The Atlantic.

On October 3, 2017, reports indicated Powell Jobs had purchased stake in the ownership group Monumental Sports & Entertainment that includes the NBA's Washington Wizards, NHL's Washington Capitals, and Capital One Arena.
In May 2018, she bought a property in San Francisco that had been listed for 16.5 million USD, on Russian Hill.
On July 28, 2017, Powell Jobs' organization Emerson Collective (based in Palo Alto, California) acquired majority ownership of The Atlantic.

Powell Jobs (born November 6, 1963) is an American businesswoman, executive and the founder of Emerson Collective, a social impact organization that, among other investing and philanthropic activities, advocates for policies concerning education and immigration reform, social justice and environmental conservation.
She is also co-founder and president of the board of College Track, which prepares disadvantaged high school students for college.
Before business school, Powell Jobs worked for Merrill Lynch Asset Management and spent three years at Goldman Sachs as a fixed-income trading strategist.
